metadata.title: CVE-2021-47293 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:net/sched: act_skbmod: Skip non-Ethernet packets Currently tcf_skbmod_act()assumes that packets use Ethernet as their L2 protocol, which is not alwaysthe case. As an example, for CAN devices: $ ip link add dev vcan0 type vcan$ ip link set up vcan0 $ tc qdisc add dev vcan0 root handle 1: htb $ tcfilter add dev vcan0 parent 1: protocol ip prio 10 \ matchall action skbmodswap mac Doing the above silently corrupts all the packets. Do not performskbmod actions for non-Ethernet packets.

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
